name: Hampton Inn Eau Claire

reviews.text: This is a typical Hampton Inn with an excellent staff. My room was clean and fresh smelling. The breakfast was the usual Hampton, but with excellent service. The front desk staff was super friendly and always greeted me as I entered or exited. Everyone made me feel very much at home and I will definitely stay here again when I
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!
rubber ducky was a nice touch

reviews.text: The hotel was nice and clean and the staff very friendly. I was very happy with my stay here. The bed was comfortable and I liked the choice of firm or soft pillows, both of which are provided on the bed automatically. On the lap desk they provide next to the remote and the channel guide was a bottle of water and a pack of Oreos. a friend of mine in another room got pretzles, so I got the better end of that deal.
reviews.title: Mid-range hotel at a mid-range price.

reviews.text: When I went into the bathroom which like the rest of the hotel was quite acceptable the first thing I noticed was a small rubber ducky sitting on the towels on the edge of the tub. I thought it was a cute touch.
reviews.title: Good solid value

reviews.text: I had a waffle for breakfast with some sausage linnks. Eggs were available but I don't eat eggs so can not tell anything of their quality. There were also donuts, muffins several types of bread , bagels cold cereals, fruit and yogurt available. Along with coffee , tea, two types of milk and three juices. The only downside was I could not find a knife. Ever try and eat a waffle without being able to cut it?
reviews.title: Best hotel in Eau Claire

reviews.text: My brother was planning to move to Eau Claire and booked at this hotel. Had a great stay, staf was friendly, gave my 1 and half year old son rubber ducks everyday that I stayed for a week. Breakfast in morning was also great and very organized. Very quite and relaxing sleep. Overall a great stay. Would recommend hotel to everyone. Thank-you Hampton Inn Eau Claire.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was that the fitness area was very small, and just a corner of the pool area. Other wise, the place was very clean, friendly, good morning breakfast food. The best personal attention I've seen in a long time by leaving me a rubber-ducky in my bathroom. Nice touch!
reviews.title: A safe bet! A typical Hampton property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an event to attend in Eau Claire on Halloween weekend and arrived at the hotel around noon in anticipation of paying for the room and returning to check in later that night. We were quite surprised and pleased when the hotel staff graciously offered us an early check-in and gave us a key. We were equally delighted to find such a lovely room waiting for us. The housekeeping staff wrote a personal note welcoming us and we laughed to find an adorable little rubber duckie dressed as a Halloween witch waiting on the bathtub. The amenities were great - everything we needed and more. The room was quiet and the bed was comfortable. It appeared to be very clean, so I was a little startled and disappointed to pull the comforter back and find several french fries on the floor next to bed. Apparently, that was one spot they missed cleaning. I rate it 4 stars for cleanliness and value (the price was a little higher than some other hotels in the vicinity). Other than that, everything else was perfect and definitely worthy of 5 stars and my recommendation.
reviews.title: Friendly, helpful staff and quiet, comfortable room made our stay an enjoyable one.

reviews.text: They don't have a restaurant on the premises, but the free continental breakfast they served in the lobby was generous and had something for everyone - scrambled eggs, biscuits with gravy, fresh fruit, cold or hot cereal, make them yourself waffles, baked goods and a variety of beverages. We were quite satisfied with the selections available.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in Eau Claire

reviews.text: The friendly, helpful staff, the quiet, comfortable room and the little personal touches made our stay at the Hampton in Eau Claire an enjoyable one.
reviews.title: The beds are always better than other brands!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while taking our daughter to tour UW Eau Claire. Originally we were going to stay at the Super 8 across the street but RAN out of there (see separate review) and this place was a welcome site compared to that. The desk staff was very nice and when we balked at the quoted price of $114 for a double room, she asked why we were visiting and when we told her the reason she offered the UWEC parent price of $79.99 which was more in line with what the motel had to offer. The lobby, our room, and the breakfast area were well-maintained and clean. The outside area had a nice touch of jack-o-lanterns and little handmade ghosts decorating the bushes for Halloween. The breakfast offered a fairly good variety of hot and cold items, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. Our room was very nice and clean and the beds featured white bedding which we appreciated rather than the typical floral-print-that-hides-stains bedding that you often see. The bathroom set up was pretty with a classy-looking vanity. The motel has a pool but we didn't take a look at it. With our discounted price, we were pleased with what we got.
reviews.title: Nice motel although a bit pricey

reviews.text: Hm, I guess I'll be a little out there and give this hotel a 5 star rating. It's not the best hotel in the world but one of the best 2 star hotels I've ever visited.
reviews.title: Good hotel for its class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good and the bedding more comfortable than any other 2 star hotel I've been in. I also really liked the set-up of the bathrooms--it had this dark wood vanity that I really liked.
reviews.title: typical hampton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice---stay at the hampton inn, go across the street for the Green Mill if you're hungry. DON'T stay at the Holiday Inn there, though!
reviews.title: Horrid Staff Ruins Decent Hotel

reviews.text: This is your typical Hampton Inn, but the rooms seem to be a little smaller. There was hardly any room around the beds. The ac wouldn''t stay on (it was HOT in the hotel), but we didn't report it. There were powdered eggs for breakfast. For the price, I don't think it's worth it. The people were nice, the rooms were clean, but for 124 / night, it's too expensive.
reviews.title: Your typical Hampton Inn

reviews.text: We were using points and were nervous as there were no recent reviews, but this was a real comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyting you would expect in the new Hampton Inns. It had comfortable bedding and everything was clean.
reviews.title: Comfortable Room, Worth A Stay, Just A Few Small 'Minuses'

reviews.text: We left before breakfast because we had to hit the road, and arrived late in the evening, so I cannot comment beyond the walls of our room.
reviews.title: Basic Hampton, but not too bad for Eau Clarie
Great Hotel
reviews.text: There is nearby fast food, and the interstate is closer than you'd think.

aka: Hampton Inn Eau Claire Hotel Eau Claire
description: Our promise includes a clean, comfortable hotel room. If you're traveling with family, you may opt for a room with two beds. Or, if alone on business, why not book a room with a plush, king-sized bed so you can stretch out and relax?Whether you're planning a corporate meeting or need accommodations for your child's sporting group, we're delighted to offer you easy planning and booking tools to make the process quick and organized.
